Key Match Events: Tyrese Maxey and Kelly Oubre Jr helped the Sixers lead after the first quarter, 28-24
Jaylen Wells had 14 first-half points for the Grizzlies
Ja Morant asserted himself early in the third quarter to help push the Grizzlies' lead into double digits
Jay Huff started to rain wide open threes down on the Sixers in the second half
Pre-Game Insights: The Sixers were still without two of their stars, Paul George and Joel Embiid, who were both still recovering from their respective knee injuries
The Grizzlies were without Desmond Bane, Marcus Smart, and a few other players in their Saturday matchup with the Sixers
Post-Match Reflections: Head coach Nick Nurse commented, 'We had a difficult time on the glass, we had a difficult time guarding the low postâ€¦we had a difficult time kind with some lob stuff at the rim.'
The team has an obvious hole for a true 'power forward' spot, and they need to explore filling it
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ja Morant continues to show that when he is healthy and focused on basketball, he is one of the best attractions in the NBA
Rebounding, which has haunted the Sixers for a couple of years now, showed up as a problem area again against the Grizzlies
Non-household names like Jaylen Wells and Jay Huff did damage against the Sixers
Others: The Sixers dropped to 1-4 on the season after the loss, while Memphis improved to 3-3 in the Western Conference
